{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.24107v1", "title": "Efficient Construction of Feasible Solutions in Column Generation using
  Quantum Annealing", "summary": "Column generation (CG) has been used to solve constrained 0-1 quadratic
programming problems. The pricing problem, which is iteratively solved in CG,
can be reduced to an unconstrained 0-1 quadratic programming problem, allowing
for the efficient application of quantum annealing (QA). The solutions obtained
by CG are continuous relaxations, which cannot be practically used as feasible
0-1 solutions. This study proposes a post-processing method for constructing
feasible 0-1 solutions from the continuous relaxations obtained through CG.
Numerical experiments on randomly generated problems demonstrate that CG with
the proposed post-processing yields solutions comparable to commercial solvers
with significantly reduced computation time.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph,cond-mat.dis-nn", "published": "2025-03-31T14:00:12Z"}
